answers.answer: Hi,What are the symptoms present? GGT may be high in liver diseases and may be associated with pancreatic disease, myocardial infarction,chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, renal failure, diabetes, obesity, medication side effect and alcoholism. On the other hand, increased direct bilirubin may suggest liver and gallbladder issues. It is best that you discuss the results with your attending physician for proper evaluation. Factors such as your medical history, symptoms present and results of other diagnostic tests are also important considerations. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: Gamma GT .... 55.... (highest range)Direct Bilirubin.....6.9.....(above highest raange)Any infomation and advice for me?Tanks in advance, Good people
title: Any thing to worry about
